userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: W.A.V. Clark's Account with George Eames, 1730 Jan, Manuscript # 2000.24, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Account of goods consigned to and that have in other ways fallen into the hands of George Eames, merchant, St. Christopher's-Nevis-Anguilla. Lists and values five ships, "Martha," "Swan," "Groton," "Lark," and "Snow Queen," and their cargoes. Commodities on board include fish, planks, shingles, staves, tobacco, guns, naval stores, peas and flour.
